text: I feel so empty inside lately. Nothing brings me joy anymore. I used to love painting and hiking, but now I can barely get out of bed. Everything feels gray and meaningless.
label: depression

text: It's been three weeks since I last felt happy. I'm going through the motions at work but inside I feel hollow. My friends keep asking if I'm okay and I just lie and say I'm fine.
label: depression

text: I slept 14 hours yesterday and still feel exhausted. The thought of doing anything productive seems impossible. I've been eating less and my appetite is completely gone.
label: depression

text: Everyone around me seems to have their life together while I'm falling apart. I feel like such a failure. I don't know why I can't just be normal like everyone else.
label: depression

text: I've been isolating myself from everyone. Even texting back feels like too much effort. The weight on my chest never goes away. I just want to feel something again.
label: depression

text: Lost my job last month and haven't told anyone. I just sit at home pretending to go to work. The shame is overwhelming. I don't see the point in trying anymore.
label: depression

text: My therapist says I'm making progress but I don't feel it. Every day is the same gray fog. I smile on the outside but inside I'm screaming. When does it get better?
label: depression

text: I used to be such a motivated person. Now I can barely shower. My room is a mess and I just don't care. I feel disconnected from everything and everyone.
label: depression

text: Crying at random times for no reason. At work, in the car, in the shower. I don't even know why anymore. The tears just come and I can't stop them.
label: depression

text: Another sleepless night staring at the ceiling. My mind won't stop with the negative thoughts. I'm so tired but sleep won't come. This cycle is exhausting.
label: depression

text: I feel worthless. Like the world would be the same or better without me. I'm just taking up space and oxygen. Nobody would really miss me if I disappeared.
label: depression

text: The medication isn't working. Two months now and I still feel the same emptiness. Maybe I'm just broken beyond repair. Maybe this is just who I am now.
label: depression

text: I can't concentrate on anything. Started reading the same paragraph five times and gave up. My brain feels foggy and slow. Simple tasks feel monumental.
label: depression

text: Missed another family dinner because I couldn't face anyone. Making up excuses is exhausting but going out feels impossible. I'm becoming a ghost in my own life.
label: depression

text: I look back at old photos and don't recognize the happy person in them. Where did that person go? I want them back but I don't know how to find them.
label: depression

text: My heart is racing and I can't breathe. I'm in a meeting and feel like I'm dying. Everyone is looking at me. I need to get out but I can't move.
label: anxiety

text: I've checked if I locked the door five times already. What if I forgot? What if someone breaks in? I know it's irrational but I can't stop the thoughts.
label: anxiety

text: Job interview tomorrow and I haven't slept in two days. My mind keeps playing out all the ways it could go wrong. What if I freeze? What if they hate me?
label: anxiety

text: Every time my phone rings I have a mini panic attack. What if it's bad news? What if something happened to someone I love? I've started avoiding calls entirely.
label: anxiety

text: I had another panic attack at the grocery store. Had to leave my cart and run to my car. It's getting worse. Now I'm scared to go shopping at all.
label: anxiety

text: My chest feels tight constantly. I've been to the ER three times thinking I was having a heart attack. Doctors say it's anxiety but it feels so real.
label: anxiety

text: Can't stop worrying about my health. Every headache is a brain tumor, every stomach ache is cancer. I Google symptoms for hours and it only makes it worse.
label: anxiety

text: Social situations terrify me. The thought of small talk makes me nauseous. I spend hours analyzing every conversation, replaying all the stupid things I said.
label: anxiety

text: I woke up at 3am with that familiar dread in my stomach. The worries started immediately. Money, work, relationships. My mind won't let me rest.
label: anxiety

text: Going to restaurants is a nightmare. What if I choke? What if I need to throw up? I always sit near the exit and hardly eat anything. It's exhausting.
label: anxiety

text: My hands won't stop shaking. I'm presenting to the team in an hour and I feel like I'm going to pass out. Why can't I just be normal about this?
label: anxiety

text: I've started avoiding driving on highways. Too many cars, too fast, too dangerous. The what-ifs play on loop. My world is getting smaller every day.
label: anxiety

text: The flight is in two days and I'm already spiraling. What if the plane crashes? What if I have a panic attack at 30,000 feet? I've almost cancelled three times.
label: anxiety

text: Every time I send an email I reread it twenty times. What if there's a typo? What if they misunderstand? What if they think I'm incompetent? It takes hours to send anything.
label: anxiety

text: I feel like everyone is judging me constantly. In the elevator, on the street, at work. Their eyes follow me. I know it's not true but the feeling won't go away.
label: anxiety

text: This week has been insane. I slept maybe 8 hours total in 5 days but I feel amazing. Started three new projects and I'm going to revolutionize everything. Watch me.
label: bipolar

text: I spent $5000 on equipment for a hobby I started yesterday. My bank account is empty but I don't care. I've never felt more alive and creative in my life.
label: bipolar

text: Last month I couldn't get out of bed. Now I've cleaned my entire apartment, started a business, and signed up for a marathon. The energy is incredible but scary.
label: bipolar

text: My thoughts are racing so fast I can barely keep up. I'm talking a mile a minute and people keep giving me weird looks. They just don't understand my vision.
label: bipolar

text: Three days ago I was ready to end it all. Today I feel invincible. These swings are exhausting. I never know which version of me will wake up tomorrow.
label: bipolar

text: I quit my job in a moment of what I thought was clarity. Now the high is fading and I'm terrified. Why do I keep sabotaging my life like this?
label: bipolar

text: The medication makes me feel flat. I miss my highs even though I know they're dangerous. At least when I was manic I felt something. Now I'm just existing.
label: bipolar

text: I went on a road trip last week on a whim. Drove 800 miles with no plan or destination. It felt amazing at the time but now I'm crashing hard.
label: bipolar

text: Friends say they don't know who I am anymore. Some days I'm the life of the party, other days I can't leave my room. I don't know who I am either.
label: bipolar

text: Started writing a novel at 2am and finished 10,000 words by morning. My fingers are cramping but my mind won't stop. I haven't eaten but food seems irrelevant.
label: bipolar

text: The crash is coming. I can feel it. These past weeks of productivity and happiness are about to turn into weeks of darkness. I'm trying to prepare but you never really can.
label: bipolar

text: I've been diagnosed for five years and I still can't predict my episodes. Lithium helps but I still cycle. The stability everyone else has seems like a fantasy.
label: bipolar

text: Made a decision during a high that destroyed my marriage. She couldn't handle the mood swings anymore. I don't blame her. I can't even handle myself.
label: bipolar

text: Hypomanic episodes feel like superpowers until they don't. I'm more creative, more social, need less sleep. Then the mania tips over or I crash into depression.
label: bipolar

text: My psychiatrist adjusted my meds again. Third time this year. It's like trying to hit a moving target. I just want to feel stable for more than a few weeks.
label: bipolar

text: I can't do this anymore. I've been holding on for so long but I'm so tired. I don't want to wake up tomorrow. I just want the pain to stop.
label: suicidewatch

text: I've written the letters. They're in my drawer. I haven't decided when but I know it's coming. I'm not asking for help. I just needed to tell someone.
label: suicidewatch

text: Everyone says it gets better but it's been years and nothing has changed. I'm 30 years old and I've felt this way since I was 15. I'm so tired of fighting.
label: suicidewatch

text: I've been researching methods. I know I shouldn't but I can't stop. The thoughts are constant now. It's like they've taken over my brain completely.
label: suicidewatch

text: Tonight feels different. I'm calm for the first time in months. I've made peace with everything. I just wanted to post here one last time.
label: suicidewatch

text: I'm not suicidal but I wouldn't mind if I didn't wake up tomorrow. Does that make sense? I don't want to actively do anything but I'd welcome the end.
label: suicidewatch

text: The only thing stopping me is my dog. He wouldn't understand where I went. As soon as he's gone, so am I. That's the only thing keeping me here.
label: suicidewatch

text: I'm a burden to everyone. My family would grieve but eventually they'd realize their lives are easier without me draining their resources and energy.
label: suicidewatch

text: I've tried everything. Therapy, medication, exercise, meditation. Nothing works. At some point you have to accept that some things can't be fixed.
label: suicidewatch

text: The intrusive thoughts are constant now. Every bridge, every tall building, every bottle of pills. My brain won't stop showing me options.
label: suicidewatch

text: I called the hotline last night. They were nice but it didn't help. How can a stranger on the phone understand what I'm going through? No one can.
label: suicidewatch

text: I'm posting here because I have no one else to tell. My family thinks I'm fine. My friends don't know the real me. I feel completely alone in this.
label: suicidewatch

text: I tried once before and failed. Sometimes I'm grateful, sometimes I'm disappointed. Today is a disappointed day. I'm getting my affairs in order.
label: suicidewatch

text: What's the point of living when every day is just pain? I've forgotten what happiness feels like. I'm exhausted from pretending everything is fine.
label: suicidewatch

text: I don't want to die, I just don't want to exist. There's a difference. I wish there was a pause button where I could just stop being for a while.
label: suicidewatch

text: I just need to vent. My boss is the worst and I can't quit because I need this job. Today she criticized my work in front of everyone. I wanted to disappear.
label: offmychest

text: I've been lying to my parents for months about having a job. I'm too ashamed to tell them I was fired. Every day the lie gets heavier.
label: offmychest

text: My best friend of 15 years just told me she's been sleeping with my ex. I feel so betrayed. I don't know who to trust anymore.
label: offmychest

text: I love my kids but sometimes I regret becoming a parent. There, I said it. I feel like a terrible person for even thinking this but it's the truth.
label: offmychest

text: I got accepted to my dream school today but I can't tell anyone because my mom just got diagnosed with cancer. I feel guilty for being happy.
label: offmychest

text: Sometimes I fantasize about just disappearing. Not hurting myself, just starting over somewhere new where nobody knows me. A clean slate sounds so appealing.
label: offmychest

text: I hate my body. I've hated it for as long as I can remember. No matter how much I exercise or diet, I never feel good enough. I'm so tired of this battle.
label: offmychest

text: My wedding is in two months and I'm not sure I love him anymore. Everyone has already bought plane tickets. I feel trapped by expectations.
label: offmychest

text: I grew up poor and now I make six figures but I still feel like an impostor. Like any day now someone will realize I don't belong and take it all away.
label: offmychest

text: I'm the family therapist. Everyone comes to me with their problems. But who do I go to? I'm drowning and nobody notices because I'm supposed to be the strong one.
label: offmychest

text: I cheated on my partner three years ago. I never told anyone. The guilt is eating me alive but telling the truth would destroy everything we've built.
label: offmychest

text: My grandmother died last week and I feel nothing. Everyone at the funeral was crying and I just felt empty. What's wrong with me? Am I a psychopath?
label: offmychest

text: I'm 35 and still don't know what I want to do with my life. Everyone around me has careers and families. I feel stuck and behind. Time is running out.
label: offmychest

text: I've been sober for 90 days today. Nobody knows I was ever an alcoholic. I had to tell someone. This is the hardest thing I've ever done.
label: offmychest

text: My husband doesn't know I read his texts. He's been messaging his ex for months. Nothing inappropriate but the secrecy hurts. I don't know what to do.
label: offmychest

text: I failed the bar exam for the third time. I've spent $100k on law school and I can't even become a lawyer. I feel like a complete failure.
label: offmychest

text: My roommate keeps eating my food and denying it. It's such a small thing but it's driving me crazy. I can't afford to move out. I'm stuck.
label: offmychest

text: I'm secretly relieved my dad is dying. He was abusive my whole childhood. Everyone expects me to be devastated. Instead I feel free. Is that evil?
label: offmychest

text: I've been pretending to work from home for months. I do maybe 2 hours of real work a day. I'm terrified of getting caught but I can't seem to stop.
label: offmychest

text: My therapist broke confidentiality and told my mom about my sessions. I feel so betrayed. That was the one safe space I had and now it's ruined.
label: offmychest

text: Today marks five years since my miscarriage. Nobody remembers but me. I still think about the baby every day. What they would have looked like, who they would have become.
label: offmychest

text: I'm transgender but I'll never come out. My family is too conservative. I'll live my whole life as someone I'm not. It's suffocating but it's the only option.
label: offmychest

text: I'm in love with my best friend's partner. I would never act on it but the feelings are there. Every time I see them together it hurts.
label: offmychest

text: I just found out I'm adopted at 40 years old. My whole life has been a lie. I don't know who I am anymore. Everything I thought I knew is wrong.
label: offmychest

text: My dog is my only friend. I talk to him more than I talk to any human. He's 12 now and I know I don't have much time left with him. I'm dreading the day.
label: offmychest

text: The darkness is back. I thought I was better but here I am again, crying in bed at 2pm on a Tuesday. The cycle never really ends, does it?
label: depression

text: I keep having intrusive thoughts about car accidents. Every time I drive I imagine crashing. I've started avoiding driving but I can't avoid it forever.
label: anxiety

text: I've been on top of the world for three days straight. No need for sleep. My girlfriend says I'm scaring her. Maybe I am a little out of control.
label: bipolar

text: I stood on the bridge for an hour last night. Just looking at the water. I didn't jump but I thought about it. Really thought about it.
label: suicidewatch

text: I found out my daughter isn't biologically mine after 10 years. DNA test confirmed it. I haven't told anyone. She's still my daughter but I don't know what to do.
label: offmychest

text: Seasonal depression hitting hard this winter. I haven't seen the sun in weeks and my mood is in the gutter. Just surviving until spring at this point.
label: depression

text: My heart skipped a beat and now I'm convinced I'm dying. Dr Google says it could be cardiac arrest. I'm too scared to go to sleep. What if I don't wake up?
label: anxiety

text: Cycling between wanting to take over the world and wanting to disappear from it. My psychiatrist says mixed episodes are the hardest to treat. I believe her.
label: bipolar

text: I saved up my pills. About a month's worth now. I'm not sure when or if I'll use them. Having them there is strangely comforting. Like having an exit strategy.
label: suicidewatch

text: I ghosted my entire friend group two years ago. No explanation, just disappeared. Now I'm lonely but too embarrassed to reach back out.
label: offmychest

text: Every morning I wake up disappointed that I woke up at all. I go through the motions but I'm not really living. Just existing until I stop.
label: depression

text: The thought of going to my own birthday party is making me nauseous. Too many people, too much attention. I'm thinking of cancelling and saying I'm sick.
label: anxiety

text: I maxed out three credit cards in a week during my last episode. The shame of dealing with the debt keeps me in bed now that I've crashed.
label: bipolar

text: I drove past the hospital on purpose today. The part of me that wants to be saved keeps doing things like that. But the bigger part just wants it to end.
label: suicidewatch

text: I told my family I'm vegan for ethical reasons. Really I just developed an eating disorder and this is the easiest way to hide it.
label: offmychest
